title: Shoplifting in the UK: A Growing Problem for Stores
summary: Shoplifting is a big problem in the UK, where people steal things from stores. A store owner named Muhammed in Stockton-on-Tees says it happens every day and costs his family business a lot of money. Sometimes, thieves get violent and hurt people. Police numbers show shoplifting went up by 13% in England and Wales, with over 500,000 cases. In Scotland, it increased by 15%. Experts say shoplifting is changing, with more people stealing different items. During Christmas, stores expect more theft because there is high demand for stolen goods. Many shoplifting cases are not reported to the police, so the real number might be much higher. Store owners often feel that police do not take action after thefts are reported.

background_read: Shoplifting is when people take items from stores without paying. It can hurt businesses and sometimes lead to violence. In the UK, police track these crimes, but many go unreported. Store owners work hard to protect their shops, especially during busy times like Christmas. Experts study this problem to find ways to stop it.
